intro: Cogswellia nuttallii var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine cogswellia, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the high altitudes of the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its unique, succulent-like leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its foliage is often a deep green with a waxy texture, and it produces striking, pinkish-white blooms in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
